attachments.text: APA (American Psychological Association) style is most commonly used to cite sources within the social sciences. This resource, revised according to the 6th edition, second printing of the APA manual, offers examples for the general format of APA research papers, in-text citations, endnotes/footnotes, and the reference page. For more information, please consult the Publication Manual of the American Psychological Association, (6th ed., 2nd printing).

item.title: Untitled
item.preview:
1. Can we replicate the findings from Clifford and Jerit (2013)? Do Democrats and Republicans attend to different moral foundations in their discussion around Stem Cell research?
  A. Democrats will focus on the Harm dimension of the stem cell debate while republicans will attend to the purity dimension. 
    For this we plan to employ the similar text analysis strategy as the authors did, but derive our corpus from topic modelling. After this, we will modify our existing dictionary to match that of the previous authors. Once this is done, we will derive documents that follow a similar event mapping if applicable.
  
2. How does moral loading change over time with respect to the following topics?
item.name: -.txt
item.preview_highlight:
1. Can we replicate the findings from Clifford and Jerit (2013)? Do Democrats and Republicans attend to different moral foundations in their discussion around Stem Cell research?
  A. Democrats will focus on the Harm dimension of the stem cell debate while republicans will attend to the purity dimension. 
    For this we plan to employ the similar text analysis strategy as the authors did, but derive our corpus from topic modelling. After this, we will modify our existing dictionary to match that of the previous authors. Once this is done, we will derive documents that follow a similar event mapping if applicable.
  
2. How does moral loading change over time with respect to the following topics?

This will be like practice for the more interesting questions we can ask about power, experience, effectiveness, language use

But let’s start on some literature. Let’s all revisit the MFT readings for class, and anything else drew points us to, to find out “how have other people asked this question?” And “what did they find?”

Let’s just set up the most basic hypotheses we can, regarding what we do when we have annotations. What’s a simple step? Ask some basic questions like “what topics go with which MFT foundations?” Then we have to think about how to answer that

Btw, the out of memory error has to do with the jdk default setting being 1GB. So any interfaces which use java cannot load more than 1 GB into RAM. You can change this default by changing the shell environment variable “HEAP_MEMORY_SIZE” or something like that

OK. So there are two steps needed to connect (I'm far from being an expert in networks, so bear with me):
1.) Tunnel in to the ssh server (this command works with linux, let me know if it doesn't with OS X):
```
ssh -Nf -L 9200:localhost:9200 <mailto:brendan@zal.usc.edu|brendan@zal.usc.edu>
```
2.) After installing the elasticsearch python API, from within a python script, create an Elasticsearch object:
```
import elasticsearch
es_client = es.Elasticsearch([{'host': 'localhost', 'port': 9200}])
```
